Record edited by Andrea Kutsenkow to reflect 2016 accretion
Fales Library and Special Collections
Dickason Papers
Dickason, Jerry G. (Jerry Grove)
Dickason, Elly, 1940-
MSS.172
12.5 Linear Feet in 19 boxes
1920-2012 This collection is comprised of materials documenting Jerry G. Dickason’s and Elly Dickason’s affiliation with the Judson Memorial Church and its associated organizations, including materials related to the production of the book Remembering Judson House, which was published in 2000. These materials date between 1920 and 2012 and include correspondence, manuscripts, research notes, research materials, galley proofs, board minutes, photographs, newspaper clippings, transcripts of sermons, church bulletins, artwork, and media.
Conditions Governing Use
NYU's Fales Library and Special Collections is not the copyright owner for this collection. Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Researchers wishing to reproduce collection material should contact rights holders for permission.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Scope and Contents
This collection is comprised of materials documenting Jerry G. Dickason’s and Elly Dickason’s affiliation with the Judson Memorial Church and its associated organizations, including materials related to the production of the book Remembering Judson House, which was published in 2000. These materials date between 1920 and 2012 and include correspondence, manuscripts, research notes, research materials, galley proofs, board minutes, photographs, newspaper clippings, transcripts of sermons, church bulletins, artwork, and media.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Dickason Papers; MSS 172; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Related Materials
The Judson Memorial Church Archive, 1838-1995 (MSS 094)
Biographical / Historical
Jerry G. Dickason, a retired professor, and Elly Dickason, a long-time member of the Judson Church congregation, edited the book Remembering Judson House (Judson Memorial Church, 2000), a compilation of 48 interviews with people who lived or worked at Judson House.
Arrangement
This collection is arranged into five series: Series I: Production Materials; Series II: Source Materials and Research; Series III: Administrative Materials Unrelated to "Remembering Judson House;" Series IV: Hot Spots Calendar (includes Production Materials), and Series V: 2016 Accretion.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The Dickason Papers were initially donated to NYU in 2002. Accretions followed in 2007 and 2013. A third accretion was donated by Jerry G. Dickason in April 2016; the accession number associated with this gift is 2016.051.
Processing Information
Decisions about the arrangement, description, and physical interventions taken on this collection prior to 2016 have not yet been recorded. In December 2016, an accretion was incorporated into the collection as a separate series. Some materials were treated for mold and then rehoused in acid-free folders and an archival manuscript box. Materials were kept in the order in which they were received from the donor, and interleaving and Mylar sleeves were used for acidic newsprint and loose photographs.
Correspondence Minutes. Manuscripts (document genre) Calendars. Audiocassettes Proofs (printed matter) Drawings Sermons. Church bulletins. Clippings. Color photographs. Arrangement
This accretion has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are arranged in the order in which they were received by the donor.
Scope and Contents
The accretion consists of materials that date between 1969 and 2012 with the bulk of the materials dating between the early 1970s and the early 1990s. Within the accretion are transcripts of sermons (including one by Elly Dickason), Judson Memorial Church bulletins, photographs used in Remembering Judson House, as well as memorial materials about the passings of composer Al Carmines and Minister Howard R. Moody. Also included in the accretion are materials about Dickason’s and former Judson employee Jim Covington’s involvement with the New York Center for Men (1983-1984), as well as a file about the research of anti-war activist Maarten Knottenbelt (1982-1989).Judson House Book1972, 2001, undated191Judson Sunday Bulletins1971-1992192-4Judson Sermons1969-1990195The New York Center for Men1983-1984196Knottenbelt, Maarten1982, 1989197Carmines, Al -- Obituary2005-2006198Carmines, Al -- Oratories1976-1977, 1990, undated199Moody, Howard R.1990, 2004, 2012, undated1910Dickason, Elly -- Sermon on Illness1992-07-261911Judson Service1994-09-041912
